title: Ticket #3248: Expose 64-bit integers and doubles in ClassAd compatibility layer
description: ClassAds support 64-bit integers and doubles. The compatibility layer (which mimics the old ClassAds API) mostly exposes 32-bit values only. We should expand the compatibility API to expose the 64-bit values.
remarks:
2012-Oct-09 09:44:34 by johnkn:
These changes look good. We still need to verify that longlong's and doubles are passed on the wire without truncation and without breaking backward compatability.

2012-Nov-12 17:41:39 by jfrey:
64-bit integers are now printed in full whenever an ad is unparsed. This includes when sent over the wire and when printed by condor_q -long or condor_status -long. When parsed by an older version of Condor, values too large for 32 bits are capped at INT_MAX and INT_MIN.

Reals are unparsed as before, with printf format %f. Native new ClassAds format unparses reals using printf format %1.15E. Changing this should wait for a future release. It requires some testing, and changing the output of the -long options should be thought about some more.

2012-Dec-06 09:46:32 by jfrey:
Preserving 64-bit values on the wire will have to wait for another version.
